description.narrative:
The Center for Applied Research and Development of Social Work (CARDSW) is a member of Faculty of Sociology, University of Social Sciences and Humanities, Vietnamese National University, Hanoi - 2005, Participated with the Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs to develop the "Law on Gender Equality" - 2006-2011: Participated in the "Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project in the Red River Delta of Vietnam (RRDRWSS) in Nam Dinh", International Development Association (IDA), World Bank - In 2012-2013, Co-chair of the project "The status of understanding and main sources of access to the Law on Gender Equality of ethnic minority women in Yen Son District, Tuyen Quang Province" funded by the Jiff Foundation - In 2013-2014, the Organization mobilized the participation of ethnic minority communities in contributing to the development of the Law on Supervision activities of the People's Council and improving the accountability of the authorities in the district. Yen Lap, Phu Tho province. - In2016-2019, Strengthen the participation of people with disabilities, social organizations and people in supervising the implementation of the Law on Education and related policies for people with disabilities in Cam Xuyen district, province Ha Tinh. - 2011-2013: Trained as a trainer for staff of the Protection Department of 63 provinces and cities on "Environmental protection in social protection establishments" organized by the Department of Protection - 2015, Organizing training for students of the Faculty of Sociology on the Law on Environmental Protection 2014; In 2018 - 2020, Join with the Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs to develop the "Law on Social Work". In 2018, Participated with the Ministry of Natural Resources and EnvironmentWorkshop on adjusting and amending "Law on environmental protection in2020"
The project researches on livelihood status of women engaged in fishing, organizes activities such as training, communicating, raising awareness and understanding of the lawfor fishing households, especially for poor women in Muong ethnic communities. Besides, the project helps to establish clubs in 5 communes and wards for women to meet, share knowledge of the law and experience in fishing, remind each other to not violateregulations and laws related to fishing. Therefore, they can maintain fish production, ensure the stable income from fishing. The project also aims to improve the capacity of local officials, agencies and mass organizations to grasp regulations, laws andtheLaw on Environmental Protection 2020. They can participate in activities of checking, monitoring, supporting for fishing households to avoid penalties for violating regulations of fishing. Therefore, the project contributes to improving the quality of life for ethnic minority women, ensuring the equity and social security, shortening the social gap between ethnic groups.

participating-org.narrative: Center for Applied Research and Development of Social Work (CARDSW)

In 2018, Participated with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment Workshop on adjusting and amending "Law on environmental protection in 2020"
